channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

Report E-2023080054

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of echo treat (un3264) had been punctured by a nail and had released 12 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080234
item.description:
Report X-2023080234

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When discovered, the package was immediately placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA. DescribePack: The side of the plastic bottle was split open due to impact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA. The product was shipped in a plastic bag, which limited spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to body structure being punctured, causing internal bottle to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA.

BOTH CONTENTS WAS SOILED AND STAINED DUE TO LIQUID EXPELLED DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UP RIGHT AND CAP TIGHTENED

item.title: Report X-2023070461
item.description:
Report X-2023070461

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box containing a class 8 was found in the Memphis dangerous goods building with signs of release. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered that one of the six glass bottles had a small crack on the bottom. The bottles were packaged in molded Styrofoam mold top and bottom. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070338
item.description:
Report X-2023070338

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/3/2023 at approximately 2220, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5006446 at the hub facility in Memphs, reporting a flammable spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboard boxes, each containing 1 metal can. Two of the packages appeared wet on the bottom. Further inspection revealed the closure of the metal can were compromised. The cause of the damage is unknown. The spillage has been contained and the undamaged pieces were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070334
item.description:
Report X-2023070334

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/1/2023 at approximately 0330, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a fire extinguisher spill. The shipment consisted of 6 fire extinguishers, 2 of which completely discharged, cause unknown. The remaning 4 extinguishers are awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for return transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070252
item.description:
Report X-2023070252

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the Dangerous Goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four metal jerrycans inside of a single plastic bag. Two of the cans were damaged on the bottom chime but only one of them released it's contents inside of the bag/box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080164
item.description:
Report X-2023080164

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg brought back to station by driver after recipient refused it due to mottling of box and bottom edge has disintegrated by becoming wet and separating. DescribePack: Contents are 2 part system of disinfectant and sterilant. Caps are vented and is fully disclosed on box exterior. The cap on one jug actually became loose which allowed internal leaking. When the cap was tightened, the jug became secure again. The cap may have been loose but not noticable until the jostling of the delivery van caused the package to actually leak. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leak was a very small amount. It absorbed into the cardboard of the outer carton. No mitigation necessary as the package was segregated immediately upon return to station.

item.title: Report X-2023080137
item.description:
Report X-2023080137

  • City: KODAK

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was brought to QA attention that the package was leaking when the package handler opened the door to begin unloading.. It was leaking prior to being moved on the trailer floor. DescribePack: Unable to see exact location of leak.. It appeared to be coming from the bottom of the medal jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quick approach to door with proper hazardous spill materials and taken to hazard cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070337
item.description:
Report X-2023070337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/2/2023 at approximately 1155, Dangerous Goods Adminsitration received a call from Employee 223990 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a resin spill. The shipment consisted of 2metal cans inside of a fiberboard box. Both cans appeared to have leaked due to compromised closures. The cause of the damage is unknown. Per the shipper's request, the package will prepared for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070259
item.description:
Report X-2023070259

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was signs of release was found during sort operations at the Memphis Dangerous goods building. The fiberboard box contained twelve small metal cans separated by fiberboard dividers. One of the of the cans was punctured just above the bottom chime causing it to release all of it's contents. All the contents of the fiberboard box were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070240
item.description:
Report X-2023070240

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 2 an overpack was found to have an odor, upon investigating the odor, a leaking steel jerrican was discovered as the source of hte odor. It contained UN1263, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 3, II. The jerrican was pulled from the overpack and placed into a steel salvage drum. The shipper stated it should be disposed of so it was sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070205
item.description:
Report X-2023070205

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/8/2023 at approximately 1100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill from a multiple-piece shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing metal cans of paint. Two of the three pieces were compromised. The master shipment, ending in -5585, contained 4 cans of paint and the shipment ending in -5600 containing 2 cans paint. The master package had minor spillage the cause was unknown. One of the metal cans completely from the shipment ending in -5600, due to body structure failing. The remainder of both shipments wer placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070078
item.description:
Report X-2023070078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the Dangerous Goods building for a leaking package. Upon arrival the agent was told that the fiberboard box fell off the rollers and struck the edge of the catwalk. This punctured the fiberboard box and one of the two metal jerrycans inside. The jerrycans were packaged with Styrofoam molding for bracing and bubble wrap for dunnage. Each jerrycan was enclosed in a single plastic bag sealed with a bag tie. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
